2. **Emergency Site Closures**
3. **Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA)**: - Birth, Adoption Placement - Caregiver (Parent, child, or Spouse) - Personal Illness or Injury - Military (Injury, Deployment, in loco parentis) - Qualifying Exigency
4. **Military Leave**
5. **Other Regulatory Leaves**: - Paid Family Leave - Paid Sick Leave
6. **Paid Parental Leave (PPL)**: - Birth or Adoption - Bonding
7. **Special Time Off**: - Bereavement / Funeral Leave - Jury Duty - School Conferences and Activities Leave - Voting Leave
8. **Unpaid Leave**: - Unpaid Medical Leave - Unpaid Family Care Leave - Unpaid Personal Leave
### Eligibility - Employees must be benefits eligible, which begins on the 31st day after hire. - Additional eligibility requirements vary depending on the type of leave requested ^1^.
### Approval Process - All leaves require approval. Employees must contact Voya to submit their leave request unless it falls under the Special Time Off Policy, in which case they should request approval from their supervisor ^2^. - Employees absent without approval are subject to the absenteeism policy and normal disciplinary action ^2^.
### Job Protection - Employees on FMLA leave are provided job protection and will be restored to the same or an equivalent job upon return ^2^. - Employees on non-FMLA leave are not guaranteed job protection and may need to work with HR to find a suitable position upon return ^2^.

3. **Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA)**: - Birth, Adoption Placement - Caregiver (Parent, child, or Spouse) - Personal Illness or Injury - Military (Injury, Deployment, in loco parentis) - Qualifying Exigency
4. **Military Leave**
5. **Other Regulatory Leaves**: - Paid Family Leave - Paid Sick Leave
6. **Paid Parental Leave (PPL)**: - Birth or Adoption - Bonding
7. **Special Time Off**: - Bereavement / Funeral Leave - Jury Duty - School Conferences and Activities Leave - Voting Leave
8. **Unpaid Leave**: - Unpaid Medical Leave - Unpaid Family Care Leave - Unpaid Personal Leave
### Eligibility - Employees must be benefits eligible, which begins on the 31st day after hire. - Additional eligibility requirements vary depending on the type of leave requested ^1^.
### Approval Process - All leaves require approval. Employees must contact Voya to submit their leave request unless it falls under the Special Time Off Policy, in which case they should request approval from their supervisor ^2^. - Employees absent without approval are subject to the absenteeism policy and normal disciplinary action ^2^.
### Job Protection - Employees on FMLA leave are provided job protection and will be restored to the same or an equivalent job upon return ^2^. - Employees on non-FMLA leave are not guaranteed job protection and may need to work with HR to find a suitable position upon return ^2^.
### Employee Responsibilities - Notify their supervisor of the date and reason for leave with 30 days' advance notice whenever possible. - Contact Voya to initiate a leave claim on or before the leave start date. - Submit all required documentation to Voya/Supervisor by the specified date. - Confirm that their The leave policy for H.B. 7. **Special Time Off**: - Bereavement / Funeral Leave - Jury Duty - School Conferences and Activities Leave - Voting Leave
8. **Unpaid Leave**: - Unpaid Medical Leave - Unpaid Family Care Leave - Unpaid Personal Leave
### Eligibility - Employees must be benefits eligible, which begins on the 31st day after hire. - Additional eligibility requirements vary depending on the type of leave requested ^1^.
### Approval Process - All leaves require approval. Employees must contact Voya to submit their leave request unless it falls under the Special Time Off Policy, in which case they should request approval from their supervisor ^2^. - Employees absent without approval are subject to the absenteeism policy and normal disciplinary action ^2^.
### Job Protection - Employees on FMLA leave are provided job protection and will be restored to the same or an equivalent job upon return ^2^. - Employees on non-FMLA leave are not guaranteed job protection and may need to work with HR to find a suitable position upon return ^2^.
### Employee Responsibilities - Notify their supervisor of the date and reason for leave with 30 days' advance notice whenever possible. - Contact Voya to initiate a leave claim on or before the leave start date. - Submit all required documentation to Voya/Supervisor by the specified date. - Confirm that their leave is approved. - Report intermittent leave timely. - Provide release to return to work documentation to Voya and supervisor. - Return to work upon expiration of leave approval. - Keep supervisor and HR informed of any changes that would impact their leave The leave policy for H.B. Employees must contact Voya to submit their leave request unless it falls under the Special Time Off Policy, in which case they should request approval from their supervisor ^2^. - Employees absent without approval are subject to the absenteeism policy and normal disciplinary action ^2^.
### Job Protection - Employees on FMLA leave are provided job protection and will be restored to the same or an equivalent job upon return ^2^. - Employees on non-FMLA leave are not guaranteed job protection and may need to work with HR to find a suitable position upon return ^2^.
### Employee Responsibilities - Notify their supervisor of the date and reason for leave with 30 days' advance notice whenever possible. - Contact Voya to initiate a leave claim on or before the leave start date. - Submit all required documentation to Voya/Supervisor by the specified date. - Confirm that their leave is approved. - Report intermittent leave timely. - Provide release to return to work documentation to Voya and supervisor. - Return to work upon expiration of leave approval. - Keep supervisor and HR informed of any changes that would impact their leave or ability to return to work as planned. - Respond in a timely manner The leave policy for H.B. 7. **Special Time Off**: - Bereavement / Funeral Leave - Jury Duty - School Conferences and Activities Leave - Voting Leave
8. **Unpaid Leave**: - Unpaid Medical Leave - Unpaid Family Care Leave - Unpaid Personal Leave
### Eligibility - Employees must be benefits eligible, which begins on the 31st day after hire. - Additional eligibility requirements vary depending on the type of leave requested ^1^.
### Approval Process - All leaves require approval. Employees must contact Voya to submit their leave request unless it falls under the Special Time Off Policy, in which case they should request approval from their supervisor ^2^. - Employees absent without approval are subject to the absenteeism policy and normal disciplinary action ^2^.
### Job Protection - Employees on FMLA leave are provided job protection and will be restored to the same or an equivalent job upon return ^2^. - Employees on non-FMLA leave are not guaranteed job protection and may need to work with HR to find a suitable position upon return ^2^.
### Employee Responsibilities - Notify their supervisor of the date and reason for leave with 30 days' advance notice whenever possible. - Contact Voya to initiate a leave claim on or before the leave start date. - Submit all required documentation to Voya/Supervisor by the specified date. - Confirm that their leave is approved. - Report intermittent leave timely. - Provide release to return to work documentation to Voya and supervisor. - Return to work upon expiration of leave approval. - Keep supervisor and HR informed of any changes that would impact their leave or ability to return to work as planned. - Respond in a timely manner to any requests for information related to their leave ^2^.

6. **Paid Parental Leave (PPL)**: - Birth or Adoption - Bonding
7. **Special Time Off**: - Bereavement / Funeral Leave - Jury Duty - School Conferences and Activities Leave - Voting Leave
8. **Unpaid Leave**: - Unpaid Medical Leave - Unpaid Family Care Leave - Unpaid Personal Leave
### Eligibility - Employees must be benefits eligible, which begins on the 31st day after hire. - Additional eligibility requirements vary depending on the type of leave requested ^1^.
### Approval Process - All leaves require approval. Employees must contact Voya to submit their leave request unless it falls under the Special Time Off Policy, in which case they should request approval from their supervisor ^2^. - Employees absent without approval are subject to the absenteeism policy and normal disciplinary action ^2^.
### Job Protection - Employees on FMLA leave are provided job protection and will be restored to the same or an equivalent job upon return ^2^. - Employees on non-FMLA leave are not guaranteed job protection and may need to work with HR to find a suitable position upon return ^2^.
### Employee Responsibilities - Notify their supervisor of the date and reason for leave with 30 days' advance notice whenever possible. - Contact Voya to initiate a leave claim on or before the leave start date. - Submit all required documentation to Voya/Supervisor by the specified date. - Confirm that their leave is approved. - Report intermittent leave timely. - Provide release to return to work documentation to Voya and supervisor. - Return to work upon expiration of leave approval. - Keep supervisor and HR informed of any changes that would impact their leave or ability to return to work as planned. - Respond in a timely manner to any requests for information related to their leave ^2^.
### Paid Leave - Pay during a leave of absence depends on the type of leave and the amount of accrued PTO available at the time the leave begins. ### Employee Responsibilities - Notify their supervisor of the date and reason for leave with 30 days' advance notice whenever possible. - Contact Voya to initiate a leave claim on or before the leave start date. - Submit all required documentation to Voya/Supervisor by the specified date. - Confirm that their leave is approved. - Report intermittent leave timely. - Provide release to return to work documentation to Voya and supervisor. - Return to work upon expiration of leave approval. - Keep supervisor and HR informed of any changes that would impact their leave or ability to return to work as planned. - Respond in a timely manner to any requests for information related to their leave ^2^.
### Paid Leave - Pay during a leave of absence depends on the type of leave and the amount of accrued PTO available at the time the leave begins. Paid leave is available for: - Paid Parental Leave - Short-term Disability - Long-term Disability - Workers Compensation - Military Leave ^4^.

Employees must contact Voya to submit their leave request unless it falls under the Special Time Off Policy, in which case they should request approval from their supervisor ^2^. - Employees absent without approval are subject to the absenteeism policy and normal disciplinary action ^2^.
### Job Protection - Employees on FMLA leave are provided job protection and will be restored to the same or an equivalent job upon return ^2^. - Employees on non-FMLA leave are not guaranteed job protection and may need to work with HR to find a suitable position upon return ^2^.
### Employee Responsibilities - Notify their supervisor of the date and reason for leave with 30 days' advance notice whenever possible. - Contact Voya to initiate a leave claim on or before the leave start date. - Submit all required documentation to Voya/Supervisor by the specified date. - Confirm that their leave is approved. - Report intermittent leave timely. - Provide release to return to work documentation to Voya and supervisor. - Return to work upon expiration of leave approval. - Keep supervisor and HR informed of any changes that would impact their leave or ability to return to work as planned. - Respond in a timely manner to any requests for information related to their leave ^2^.
### Paid Leave - Pay during a leave of absence depends on the type of leave and the amount of accrued PTO available at the time the leave begins. Paid leave is available for: - Paid Parental Leave - Short-term Disability - Long-term Disability - Workers Compensation - Military Leave ^4^.

3. **Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA)**: - Birth, Adoption Placement - Caregiver (Parent, child, or Spouse) - Personal Illness or Injury - Military (Injury, Deployment, in loco parentis) - Qualifying Exigency
4. **Military Leave**
5. **Other Regulatory Leaves**: - Paid Family Leave - Paid Sick Leave
6. **Paid Parental Leave (PPL)**: - Birth or Adoption - Bonding
7. **Special Time Off**: - Bereavement / Funeral Leave - Jury Duty - School Conferences and Activities Leave - Voting Leave
8. **Unpaid Leave**: - Unpaid Medical Leave - Unpaid Family Care Leave - Unpaid Personal Leave
### Eligibility - Employees must be benefits eligible, which begins on the 31st day after hire. - Additional eligibility requirements vary depending on the type of leave requested ^1^.
### Approval Process - All leaves require approval. Employees must contact Voya to submit their leave request unless it falls under the Special Time Off Policy, in which case they should request approval from their supervisor ^2^. - Employees absent without approval are subject to the absenteeism policy and normal disciplinary action ^2^.
### Job Protection - Employees on FMLA leave are provided job protection and will be restored to the same or an equivalent job upon return ^2^. - Employees on non-FMLA leave are not guaranteed job protection and may need to work with HR to find a suitable position upon return ^2^.
### Employee Responsibilities - Notify their supervisor of the date and reason for leave with 30 days' advance notice whenever possible. - Contact Voya to initiate a leave claim on or before the leave start date. - Submit all required documentation to Voya/Supervisor by the specified date. - Confirm that their leave is approved. - Report intermittent leave timely. - Provide release to return to work documentation to Voya and supervisor. - Return to work upon expiration of leave approval. - Keep supervisor and HR informed of any changes that would impact their leave or ability to return to work as planned. - Respond in a timely manner to any requests for information related to their leave ^2^.
### Paid Leave - Pay during a leave of absence depends on the type of leave and the amount of accrued PTO available at the time the leave begins. Paid leave is available for: - Paid Parental Leave - Short-term Disability - Long-term Disability - Workers Compensation - Military Leave ^4^.

Employees must contact Voya to submit their leave request unless it falls under the Special Time Off Policy, in which case they should request approval from their supervisor ^2^.\n- Employees absent without approval are subject to the absenteeism policy and normal disciplinary action ^2^.\n\n### Job Protection\n- Employees on FMLA leave are provided job protection and will be restored to the same or an equivalent job upon return ^2^.\n- Employees on non-FMLA leave are not guaranteed job protection and may need to work with HR to find a suitable position upon return ^2^.\n\n### Employee Responsibilities\n- Notify their supervisor of the date and reason for leave with 30 days' advance notice whenever possible.\n- Contact Voya to initiate a leave claim on or before the leave start date.\n- Submit all required documentation to Voya/Supervisor by the specified date.\n- Confirm that their leave is approved.\n- Report intermittent leave timely.\n- Provide release to return to work documentation to Voya and supervisor.\n- Return to work upon expiration of leave approval.\n- Keep supervisor and HR informed of any changes that would impact their leave or ability to return to work as planned.\n- Respond in a timely manner to any requests for information related to their leave ^2^.\n\n### Paid Leave\n- Pay during a leave of absence depends on the type of leave and the amount of accrued PTO available at the time the leave begins. Paid leave is available for:\n - Paid Parental Leave\n - Short-term Disability\n - Long-term Disability\n - Workers\u2019 Compensation\n - Military Leave ^4^.\n\nFor more detailed information, please refer to the specific sections of the leave policy document ^1^ ^2^ ^3^ ^4^.", "sources": [{"name": "Leave Policy.pdf", "path": "https://hbfuller.sharepoint.com/sites/hr/HR%20News%20%20Posts/Leave%20Policy.pdf"}], "raise_ticket": false}
